alert.note: Alert for Cherokee (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 07 at 5:41PM CDT until August 07 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of central Alabama, including the following county, Cherokee. * WHEN...Until 630 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 541 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cedar Bluff, Little River Canyon National Preserve, Leesburg, Sand Rock, Gaylesville, Cornwall Furnace Park, Blanche, Western Weiss Lake, Eastern Weiss Lake, Cherokee Rock Village, Chesnut Bay Resort, Yellow Creek Falls, Broomtown, Fullerton and New Moon.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
